item.title: Ukraine interior ministry leadership killed in helicopter crash
item.description: Ukraine's interior minister, his deputy, and another official are among 17 killed in the crash.

item.title: Police investigator quit over black athletes' stop and search case
item.description: Trisha Napier says her investigation of the Bianca Williams and Ricardo Dos Santos case was "watered down".

item.title: All forces must check officers against police database, says Home Office
item.description: The order follows the serving Met Police officer David Carrick admitting to being a serial rapist.

item.title: Keep cake away from office, suggests food watchdog head
item.description: The Food Standards Agency chairwoman says workers should think about colleagues' health.

item.title: World's oldest person, French nun Sister André, dies aged 118
item.description: Sister André, a French nun who took holy orders in 1944, died at her nursing home in Toulon.

item.title: Ambulance staff and nurses to strike on same day
item.description: The walkout in England and Wales on 6 February is set to be the biggest yet in this NHS pay dispute.

item.title: Plane ticket prices soared by 44% in December
item.description: Air fares rose at the fastest pace since 1989 while coach travel costs also jumped.

item.title: Ian Kirwan: Boy guilty of Redditch Asda stabbing murder
item.description: Ian Kirwan was stabbed to death after telling off teens for messing about in Asda store toilets.

item.title: First MoT could be delayed to cut costs for drivers
item.description: Testing cars after four years - rather than three - would not affect road safety, the government says.

item.title: Kaylea Titford: Father's neglect led to obese daughter's death, court told
item.description: Kaylea, 16, was found dead at home, weighing almost 23 stone and on soiled sheets, a court hears.

item.title: Polar bear kills woman and boy in Alaska village
item.description: The bear entered a remote community and began chasing after residents before being shot dead, police said.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Can I get a Cold Weather Payment and how much are they?
item.description: Cold Weather Payments are available to some when there is a run of sub-zero temperatures.

item.title: Takeaway owner says free pizzas offer has been 'very stressful'
item.description: Takeaway owner Marc Wilkinson says the giveaway will cost him three times more than he estimated.

item.title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: How to stay warm and cope with the cold weather
item.description: Much of the UK is facing another cold snap amid rising fuel costs.

item.title: Cost of living: Debt fears after Christmas on credit
item.description: A charity says the knock-on effect will be felt in coming months as people cannot pay their bills.

item.title: Cost of living: What do I do if I can't afford to pay my debts?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: Dr Ranj: Four ways to protect your mental health as debt rises
item.description: The rising cost of living can be stressful but there are steps you can take to help.

item.title: Cost of living: The father and son who write poetry for tough times
item.description: Winston "Mayor" Lindsay and his son, Zayden, perform poetry about socio-economic issues.

item.title: Cost of living: The young people saving money by going sober
item.description: With the price of alcohol going up, young people say they're saving money by going sober.

item.title: The Suffolk manor house where 60 people live together
item.description: Members of a farming community who live in an old friary feel protected from the cost-of-living crisis.

item.title: Cost of living: 'We had to bath our kids in the kitchen sink'
item.description: A rural family who ran out of heating oil say they were forced to wash their children in the kitchen.

item.title: Repairing broken gadgets for a greener future
item.description: A group of volunteers in Camden, London, want to save your broken electricals from the scrapheap.

item.title: What is the energy price cap and what will happen to bills?
item.description: The energy bill support package will continue after April, but will be less generous.

item.title: Can batch cooking help cut your shopping bills?
item.description: Suzanne Mulholland's time saving tips have gathered her a significant following on social media.

item.title: Energy bills: What cost-of-living payments are available and how do you claim?
item.description: Low-income households, pensioners and some disabled people can get extra help with energy bills.

item.title: Shower at home vs at the gym: What’s cheaper?
item.description: We investigate if getting a gym membership could actually save you money in the shower.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and why is the cost of living rising?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising has fallen slightly, but inflation remains near a 40-year high.

item.title: BBC Food's family £1 recipe meal plan
item.description: This budget-friendly meal plan covers a week's worth of dinners for four adults, coming in at under £28 in total.

item.title: Iran protests: 15 minutes to defend yourself against the death penalty
item.description: Iran's courts are convicting protesters after fast-track trials that activists say are grossly unfair.

item.title: Seoul Halloween crush: A grieving father's promise to his daughter
item.description: Relatives say authorities are responding to the disaster in a cold and indifferent way.

item.title: Scotland Gender Recognition Bill: What are the sticking points?
item.description: A plan to make it easier to get a gender recognition certificate has led to a constitutional row.

item.title: 'Rugby helped me heal after the pain of stillbirth'
item.description: A woman who had a stillborn baby says playing rugby saved her life.

item.title: Nigeria elections 2023: How influencers are secretly paid by political parties
item.description: Nigerian politicians are hiring social media influencers to spread disinformation ahead of February's elections.

item.title: Chess gets a risqué makeover
item.description: Ilya Merenzon, CEO of World Chess, shares his business advice for our CEO Secrets series.

item.title: Strikes Update: How nurses' strikes on Wednesday will affect you
item.description: What you need to know about the nurses' strike and other industrial action, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

item.title: Matteo Messina Denaro: How Mafia boss was caught on a visit to a clinic
item.description: Italian police arrested Matteo Messina Denaro as he walked from a clinic to a cafe.

item.title: Andrey Medvedev: How Russian mercenary says he made an icy escape to Norway
item.description: Andrey Medvedev's escape makes him the first Wagner Group mercenary to defect to the West.

item.title: Madonna announces a career-spanning greatest hits tour
item.description: The global tour will celebrate the 40th anniversary of her breakthrough single, Holiday, in 1983.

item.title: Prince William reveals who's the best cook at home
item.description: The Prince of Wales unveils his winning dish in the kitchen and rates Catherine's culinary skills too.

item.title: Children pay royal tribute with their word of 2022
item.description: Six to 14 year-olds were asked in a survey for words they felt had been important during the year.

item.title: BBC Breakfast: Forty years of early morning bloopers
item.description: A look back at some of the unexpected funny moments in the history of the BBC's morning news programme.

item.title: Scotland gender bill: What next for Sunak and Sturgeon?
item.description: The Union has a clash on its hands, writes James Cook, BBC News's Scotland editor.

item.title: Australian Open 2023 results: Emma Raducanu loses to Coco Gauff in Melbourne
item.description: British number one Emma Raducanu is out of the Australian Open after losing in straight sets to Coco Gauff in an entertaining second-round match.

item.title: Snooker match-fixing investigation - 10 Chinese players charged by WPBSA
item.description: Ten Chinese players face match-fixing charges as snooker's governing body investigates the sport's biggest corruption scandal.

item.title: Nadal 'mentally destroyed' after second-round exit
item.description: Injured Rafael Nadal says he is "mentally destroyed" after his Australian Open title defence comes to an end in the second round.

item.title: Equal pay: Football Association of Wales agree landmark deal
item.description: Wales' men's and women's senior players will be paid the same for representing their country for the first time.

item.title: Masterclass: Alessia Russo of Man Utd shows you how to be a top forward
item.description: England and Manchester United striker Alessia Russo breaks down her game in a close-range finishing masterclass, including forward runs, first touch and plenty of goalscoring.
